name: Someone In A Tree Quiz | Musicals | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who is the commodore who comes to Japan?
questions.explanation:
Matthew Perry.

	The real Commodore Perry was born in 1794 and died in 1858, only  three years after returning to the U.S. after opening Japan up to foreign trade. In the original Broadway production, Perry was played by Haruki Fujimoto.

questions.text: What does the Fisherman describe the four black ships as?
questions.explanation:
Four black dragons.

	In the number "Four Black Dragons", Japanese townspeople react to Commodore Perry's ships. When they come ashore, some people reject them and some welcome them and adapt to their culture.

questions.text: Who does NOT sing in "Someone in a Tree"?
questions.explanation:
Fisherman.

	The Old Man tells the Reciter that he saw the meeting between Commodore Perry and Japanese officials, and as his memory falters his younger self comes out. "Someone in a Tree" has been identified by Sondheim as his personal favorite out of all the songs he wrote.

questions.text: Kayama is one character that sings "Poems", but who is the other?
questions.explanation:
Manjiro.

	Kayama and Manjiro were played by Isao Sato and Sab Shimono, respectively. "Poems" is just that, each character reciting a poem one after the other.

questions.text: In 2005, "Pacific Overtures" was revived at Studio 54. Who played the Reciter?
questions.explanation:
B.D. Wong

	B.D Wong has also been seen in "You're A Good Man, Charlie Brown" as Linus and "Face Value" as Randall Lee. He also appeared in the concert "Children and Art", celebrating Sondheim's 75th birthday.

questions.text: How old is the Young Boy?
questions.explanation:
Ten.

	In "Someone in a Tree", a repeated line of the Young Boy's is "I am in a tree, I am ten. I am in a tree." The Young Boy is good at climbing trees, but the Old Man is less adept at it.

questions.text: Complete the lyric from "Please Hello": "Last time we visit, too short./ This time we visit for _____."
questions.explanation:
slow.

	"Please Hello" is sung in broken English, representing the language dsifferences between the Japanese and the nations that came pouring in after Perry visits. The best line in the song is "President Fillmore now named Pierce!"

questions.text: What is the third item that the samurai Kayama wears in "A Bowler Hat"?
questions.explanation:
A monocle.

	"A Bowler Hat" is sung by Kayama as he gradually modernizes himself, adapting to Western culture. First he is given a bowler hat, and he goes on to read English, enjoy Spinoza, and wear a tailcoat.

questions.text: Who played the Reciter in the original Broadway cast?
questions.explanation:
Mako.

	Mako not only played the Reciter, but Jonathan Goble and a Shogun as well. He has also been seen in "M*A*S*H" and episodes of "Seventh Heaven" and "Walker, Texas Ranger".

questions.text: According to the original lyrics for "Next", how many Toyota dealerships are in Detroit?
questions.explanation:
Eight.

	In the revival production, these facts were replaced with new ones. Examples are: "In 1991, Japanese investors bought the Empire State Building." and "Sony is now the #1 brand name in America".
